items.sentence: I doubt Tom can comprehend what we\'re talking about.
I\'m extremely disappointed in how things turned out.
Would you have come to visit me if I had invited you?
Would you like to come in for an interview next week?
Would you like to go for a drink or something to eat?
Would you like to see your wife lose a little weight?
Would you mind putting these back where you got them?
Would you mind telling me how you got into my office?
Tom\'s father gave him a sports car for his birthday.
I read the newspaper every day when I was in college.
When was the last time you had a good night\'s sleep?
Are you going to be able to do this without any help?
Do you expect me to believe you did this by yourself?
Tom ran away from the orphanage when he was thirteen.
Tell Tom he has to do everything Mary asks him to do.
Thank you for taking the time to answer my questions.
The Jacksons have invited us over for dinner tonight.
The book that I wanted was at the bottom of the pile.
I wonder whether or not Tom can do what we\'ve asked.
I dated a girl in high school who could speak French.
If you can\'t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
If you take this medicine, you\'ll feel a lot better.
The police said they found Tom\'s fingerprints there.
The police were at Tom\'s door with a search warrant.
How much did you have to pay to get your truck fixed?
How much public money has been spent on that project?
I advise you not to walk home by yourself after dark.
I almost had enough money to buy everything I needed.
I always drink a glass of milk before going to sleep.
I asked Tom to sing that song he used to always sing.
French is the only language that I know how to speak.
Have you decided what your Halloween costume will be?
I believe you know what you\'re supposed to be doing.
I don\'t think Tom is the kind of guy who\'d do that.
My guess is that Tom isn\'t going to want to do that.
Tom and Mary played games on their iPads all morning.
Tom and Mary say that they have the perfect marriage.
Tom and Mary were too tired to argue with each other.
Tom began to wonder who Mary had learned French from.
Tom bought his daughter a Macintosh for her birthday.
Tom came to Boston after graduating from high school.
Tom was really surprised when Mary told him to leave.
Tom was surprised how well Mary could play the piano.
Tom went to the hospital because he had a high fever.
Tom was caught stealing money from the cash register.
Tom was much richer than me before I won the lottery.
Tom will try to finish the work as early as possible.
I fell in love with a girl I met in Boston last year.
I don\'t think Tom knows what I\'m making for dinner.
I think we should continue this conversation outside.
